intro: Damnacanthus guangxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi Damnacanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its ornamental, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
